bibl.title: New Data on the Chronology of Late Roman Lamps in Alexandria.
bibl.note: 1. Subject of study. A deposit of pottery in locus H-2 within the Late Roman habitation quarter (Sector W1N) at Kom el-Dikka is of primary importance for the chronology and typology of numerous lamps from Alexandria and Egypt. - 2. Technique. - 3. Repertory of types and series. - 4 Imported lamps. - 5. Conclusions.
bibl.seg: MLYNARCZYK Jolanta, New Data on the Chronology of Late Roman Lamps in Alexandria.

1. Subject of study. A deposit of pottery in locus H-2 within the Late Roman habitation quarter (Sector W1N) at Kom el-Dikka is of primary importance for the chronology and typology of numerous lamps from Alexandria and Egypt. - 2. Technique. - 3. Repertory of types and series. - 4 Imported lamps. - 5. Conclusions.
